howto_modal_description.defaultMessage: Follow these steps to properly document a bridge.

howto_modal_step1_desc.defaultMessage: Position the marker on the map exactly on the bridge. You can use the location feature to use your current GPS position, or manually move the marker to the correct position. Accurate positioning is important for documentation.

howto_modal_step2_desc.defaultMessage: Photograph the bridge frontally from the water side – from an otter's perspective. The photo should show the passage under the bridge. This helps us assess how accessible the passage is for otters.

howto_modal_step3_desc.defaultMessage: Estimate the bridge dimensions: width (span of the passage), height (from water level to bridge underside) and length/depth (how long is the passage). The bridge index (BI) is calculated from these measurements. A BI above 1.5 is considered otter-friendly – the passage is large enough for safe crossing.

howto_modal_step4_desc.defaultMessage: Assess the bridge surroundings: Is there a continuous banquette (bank strip) of at least 30 cm width on one side? Are there stones protruding from the water that can serve as marking spots? Is the bank continuous before and after the bridge, or do animals need to cross the road? Are there obstacles like weirs or drops over 1 meter within 20 meters?

howto_modal_step5_desc.defaultMessage: Record the traffic situation: How many vehicles pass the bridge during your observation? What is the speed limit on the road? Are there barriers like fences or walls that could prevent animals from safely crossing the road? This data helps with risk assessment.

overlapping_bridges_subtitle.defaultMessage: Select a bridge to view details

overview_export_alert_copied_to_clipboar.defaultMessage: The link was copied to the clipboard.

report_bridge_images_required.defaultMessage: At least one image must be uploaded

report_bridge_label_barriers.defaultMessage: Barriers to get on the road

report_bridge_label_hasContinuousShore.defaultMessage: Bank area at least continuous on one side before and after the bridge?

report_bridge_label_hasSlopes.defaultMessage: Thresholds / drops of 1m height within a distance of 20m from the bridge?

report_bridge_label_position_hint.defaultMessage: The respective lists of cantons and municipalities are combined with the determined values of the set point.

report_bridge_placeholder_bridgeHeight.defaultMessage: highest point from centre waterline in m

settings_about_text.defaultMessage: This app was developed by {tegonalLink} on behalf of {prolutraLink}.

visible_bridges_subtitle.defaultMessage: Bridges in the current map view

welcome_modal_description.defaultMessage: With this app you can record bridges in Switzerland and assess their safety for otters. The bridge index (BI) shows whether a bridge is otter-friendly (BI > 1.5).

welcome_modal_feature_clustering_desc.defaultMessage: With many bridges, nearby pins are grouped into circles with a number. Zoom in to see individual bridges.

welcome_modal_feature_filters_desc.defaultMessage: Filter bridges by safety risk or canton. In the view options you can turn clustering on or off and choose the map style.

welcome_modal_feature_locate_desc.defaultMessage: Position the map to your current location to find bridges near you.

welcome_modal_feature_pins_desc.defaultMessage: The pins show recorded bridges. The color indicates the safety risk: green (otter-friendly) to purple (very high risk). Tap a pin for details.

welcome_modal_feature_report_desc.defaultMessage: Report a new bridge with photos from the water side, bridge dimensions and traffic data.
